instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> kernel panic
threads.message:
This board came from a liquid damage mac,has corrosion on <CAPACITOR>C1902</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C1922</CAPACITOR>, rest of board looks clean with no corrosion or burned looking components. 

Tried to boot up via my external ssd, came up with kernel panic, then tried a known good ssd and it booted fine, noticed that the camera stayed black and didnt come on (could be because of <CAPACITOR>C1922</CAPACITOR>?). 

The problem is that the mac will not longer boot, gets stuck loading the os (with internal ssd) , i always seem to get kernel panic if i run through external ssd. loads into diagnostics which show no issues.

Ive seen another post on here from a guy who said he ran ASD on it to diagnose a ram issue, i thought theres no asd for the 2015? (never used asd before)

What could be wrong? how do i rule out the cpu and ram?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> kernel panic
threads.message: Replace <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> and check traces to Y1905.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> kernel panic
threads.message: took off <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> noticed pin 5 was corroded and missing pad so ran a jumper and now the mac works fine.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> kernel panic
